paper_abstract: For a two-variable formula B(X, Y) of Monadic Logic of Order (MLO) the Church synthesis problem concerns the existence and construction of a finite-state operator Y = F(X) such that B(X, F(X)) is universally valid over Nat. Buchi and Landweber (1969) proved that the Church synthesis problem is decidable. We investigate a parameterized version of the Church synthesis problem. In this extended version a formula B and a finite-state operator F might contain as a parameter a unary predicate P. A large class of predicates P is exhibited such that the Church problem with the parameter P is decidable. Our proofs use composition method and game theoretical techniques. (C) 2012 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: The Church problem for expansions of (N, <) by unary predicates
